boardgame.name: Exodus: Proxima Centauri
boardgame.description: After a devastating nuclear war, six human factions are seeking shelter in the Centauri system. On the verge of extinction, the humans are saved by a superior civilization, allegedly the Centaurians, and each faction is given a fresh start on a new planet. Thus the exodus of humanity seems to have ended on the planets orbiting the star called Proxima Centauri. When the Centaurians announce their departure, the struggle for power commences once again._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In Exodus: Proxima Centauri, the six factions fight for dominance in an epic empire-building game, striving to build a new human empire on the ashes of the Centaurian civilization. Each player will build his own space fleet of customized ships and conquer new planets, fight the Centaurian Resistance and the other players, negotiate and vote for political decisions, research Centaurian technologies, and much more._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Exodus is a 4X game featuring a tech tree, blind bidding on political laws and resolutions, hidden movement, resource management, logistics, and engine building. Exodus is a game that greatly encourages and rewards combat with NPCs and other players--both through ships and weapons of mass destruction._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Interactive Setup for Exodus (nskn.net)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Punched, but unplayed. The condition of this is actually closer to _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Like New_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;, but I wanted to err on the side of caution. This game has been punched and sorted into GMT counter trays (included). As originally packaged, it included several punchsheets with extra tokens, and an entire bag of pre-punched pieces, so there are many extra unpunched tokens. As was typical for this game, some (very few) of the tokens may have experienced very minor cardboard separation from when they were punched, but I would be hard-pressed to tell you which ones.

PASSPORT GAME STUDIOS (PGSNSK004) Inspired by Stanisław Lem_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;The Magellanic Cloud_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;, Exodus: Proxima Centauri is the first game of a sci-fi trilogy. In a new universe, marked by a fierce struggle for power, the humanity is building a new civilization on the ashes of a dying race, the Centaurians. Exodus: Proxima Centauri is a full civilization game for experienced players, who enjoy immersing themselves in a new universe and fight for supremacy in a flavored, thematic game. After a devastating nuclear war, six human factions are seeking shelter in the Centauri system. On the verge of extinction, the humans are saved by a superior civilization, allegedly the Centaurians, and each faction is given a fresh start on a new planet. Thus the exodus of humanity seems to have ended on the planets orbiting the star called Proxima Centauri. When the Centaurians announce their departure, the struggle for power commences once again. In Exodus: Proxima Centauri, the six factions fight for dominance in an epic empire-building game, striving to build a new human empire on the ashes of the Centaurian civilization. Each player will build his own space fleet of customized ships and conquer new planets, fight the Centaurian Resistance and the other players, negotiate and vote for political decisions, research Centaurian technologies, and much more. REVISED EDITION: After the success of Exodus: Proxima Centauri and backed by popular demand, NSKN Games is proud to announce the long awaited re-print. We did a little more than simple sending the request to the manufacturing company for another batch of games, we updated the look-and-feel of the games, the quality of the components and a few game concepts. The biggest change is the graphic aspect of the game. With the help of a professional American graphic designer, David Coffey, most Exodus components have a new look, following the theme of the game. Every piece of the hex map has a design of its own, featuring a unique planet. The ship blueprints are now integrated on the player boards, together with the technology tree and the resource tracks, reducing the overall number of game components and adding to the ergonomics of the game. Not only each technology gained an improved look, but all the player boards together with the common board are now made of thick cardboard.
Brand new, in original shrink-wrap. Revised Edition.
